programme.title: Shark Attack 360
programme.desc: The 360 team investigate a spate of shark attacks in Ballina, a small seaside town just on the east coast of Australia. The team puts local theories to the test, myth busting old beliefs and revealing fascinating shark biology. In the lab, Diva analyses the data and uncovers a starling truth behind these bites.

programme.title: Shark Attack 360
programme.desc: The 360 team investigates an attack on a foil boarder in Australia. Are sharks attracted to these boards and does something stimulate an attack? Meeting with hydrodynamic experts, the team discovers that these boards may trigger sharks. In the field, the team examine how and why.

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how Nile crocodiles hunt, offering new perspectives on the patient and precise tactics they use when ambushing migratory herds of wildebeest and zebra that pass through their territories. A male crocodile must target large prey in a bid to survive the harshest time of the year.

programme.title: Shark Attack 360
programme.desc: Diva uncovers a mysterious spate of shark bites in California. But these bites are in the winter when the sharks are usually long gone. To understand the reasons behind this cluster of encounters the 360 team gets to work. As they scour the world for clues, their investigation takes them to Israel, Australia and South Africa.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Within the Channel Country deserts, Indigenous educator Phil Breslin scours the endless sands to find three animals that not only survive the heat but thrive in unrelenting conditions. Get ready to meet Australia‚Äôs most impressive animals: the perentie, the continent‚Äôs largest lizard; the emu, its fastest flightless bird; and the mighty red kangaroo, the world‚Äôs largest marsupial.

programme.title: The Incredible Pol Farm
programme.desc: It‚Äôs winter on the farm, and the Pol‚Äôs are adding to their flock! The family is bringing in four merino ewes that were recently bred, which means with any luck the farm could be expecting its first lambs come springtime. And as winter fades into spring, the Pol‚Äôs prepare for the new arrivals by building a lambing pen. Meanwhile, Beth checks if her bees survived the winter.

programme.title: Africa's River Titans
programme.desc: Africa is a land of giants. Its powerful rivers sculpt the earth and form impressive valleys and waterways home to many imposing and powerful inhabitants. These are the rivers where massive elephants and hippos live, feed and drink and where ancient crocodiles hunt and breed.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin ventures into Australia‚Äôs notorious wetlands to discover three animals built for the muggy and wet environment. Phil comes face to face with the uniquely Australian freshwater crocodile, a massive predatory fish called the barramundi, and the saltwater crocodile, one of the world‚Äôs most dangerous animals and largest reptiles.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin heads along the cliffs and sandy flats of the Australian coast to discover which animal dominates the shoreline. His first encounter is with a white -bellied sea eagle, a bird with extremely sharp talons, followed by the estuarine stonefish, the most venomous fish in the world. Finally, Phil takes a closer look at the notorious stingray.

programme.title: Underdogs
programme.desc: Ryan Reynolds reveals some highly questionable parenting strategies from the animal kingdom‚Äôs worst parents, the underdogs. From a goose who lays their eggs on the top of a cliff to a koala that feeds its baby poop, it‚Äôs uncertain if they bad parents or just misunderstood. But no matter how bad one thinks they may be at parenting; they can‚Äôt be as bad as these guys.

programme.title: Extraordinary Australia
programme.desc: From lush ancient rainforests to wet grassland and dry eucalyptus forest, Australias diverse habitats are home to an array of weird and wonderful creatures found nowhere else on the planet. From the bizarre anatomy of the platypus to the savage screams of Tasmanian devils, the creatures of Australia rely on extraordinary adaptations to survive in continents vast and diverse habitats. .

programme.title: Extraordinary Australia
programme.desc: Australias coastline is a true natural wonder, encompassing a diverse range of bountiful habitats. Coastal seas and lands are realms of epic migrations, mesmerising mating rituals and high stakes battles between predator and prey. .

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: The clinic is slammed with summertime cases as the vets battle to save a badly injured cat, a farm dog with a puncture wound, and a wobbling mini horse struggling to walk. The team is seeing double as pairs of ferrets and chickens come through the door. Doc and Dianes new puppy brings chaos and cuteness to the clinic.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Armed with a bucket and tube, Dr. Pol works tirelessly to help a horse struggling with choke. Inside the clinic, Dr. Lisa tackles the many maladies of Mushi the cat, and Dr. Brenda treats a fussy feline. Something odd happens when Doc meets another DocDr. Strange the steer. Charles is worried about his dog Athena and looks to his dad for guidance. .

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: The staffers become the clients as they bring in their pets for the vets to treat. Dr. Pol builds a special cast for an injured calf, Dr. Lisa chases a pair of goats, and Dr. Brenda has to change her plans when a reindeers symptoms suddenly change. With a goose, bunny, and pregnant pup all at the clinic, the staff works hard keeping Pol Vet running smoothly. .

programme.title: Sharks Up Close With Bertie Gregory
programme.desc: Bertie heads to South Africa for his most dangerous mission yet. The wild waters here are a hotspot for one of the ocean‚Äôs most famous and fearsome predators: the great white shark. Bertie will attempt to film them hunting seals underwater without the use of a protective cage. It‚Äôs highly risky, but filming without the cage is the very best way to see them behaving naturally.

programme.title: Cannibal Sharks
programme.desc: CANNIBAL SHARKS pulls in two of the world‚Äôs leading shark experts to unpack and analyze the mounting evidence that shark-on-shark attacks happen a lot more than we ever realized. .

programme.title: Sharks Of The North
programme.desc: Sightings of great white sharks have been on the rise in Atlantic Canada. Alanna Canaran, a passionate science educator and dive instructor, embarks on a mission to unravel the enigmas surrounding these magnificent creatures and is determined to dispel fear of sharks in Nova Scotians. As the journey unfolds, Canaran and her team dive into the history of human-shark relationships along the coast.

programme.title: World's Biggest Bullshark?
programme.desc: Marine Ecologist, Dr. Neil Hammerschlag teams up with former Royal Marine Commando, James Glancy and Evolutionary Biologist, Dr. Toby Daly-Engel to uncover how Big Bull, one of the largest Bull Sharks ever caught, grew to become a giant and find out if there could be more like her.

programme.title: Return Of The White Shark
programme.desc: Cape Cod ‚Äî America‚Äôs Playground ‚Äî is a newly emerging hotspot for a top predator. Great Whites are appearing in increasing numbers, when for centuries there were none. Through spectacular imagery, we‚Äôll see how the landscape of Cape Cod has changed over time, and what is luring Great Whites in record numbers.

programme.title: Wild Mississippi
programme.desc: This blue-chip natural history special is the first of three hours that take us on a wild journey down the Mississippi to reveal a river you only think you know. Beginning in the fall at the very head of the river, we follow its path to find hungry wolves, freezing bobcats, warring bald eagles, hapless porcupines, and phantom owls that hunt what they can't see.

programme.desc: At more than 4,000 miles long, the worlds mightiest river -- the Amazon -- is an inland ocean, teeming with life.
